channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Assisting in Writing Wikipedia-like Articles From Scratch with Large Language Models
item.description: We study how to apply large language models to write grounded and organized long-form articles from scratch, with comparable breadth and depth to Wikipedia pages.

item.title: Mini-Gemini: Mining the Potential of Multi-modality Vision Language Models
item.description: We try to narrow the gap by mining the potential of VLMs for better performance and any-to-any workflow from three aspects, i. e., high-resolution visual tokens, high-quality data, and VLM-guided generation.

item.title: InstantMesh: Efficient 3D Mesh Generation from a Single Image with Sparse-view Large Reconstruction Models
item.description: We present InstantMesh, a feed-forward framework for instant 3D mesh generation from a single image, featuring state-of-the-art generation quality and significant training scalability.

item.title: LM Transparency Tool: Interactive Tool for Analyzing Transformer Language Models
item.description: We present the LM Transparency Tool (LM-TT), an open-source interactive toolkit for analyzing the internal workings of Transformer-based language models.

item.title: Magic Clothing: Controllable Garment-Driven Image Synthesis
item.description: We propose Magic Clothing, a latent diffusion model (LDM)-based network architecture for an unexplored garment-driven image synthesis task.

item.title: Solving Data Quality Problems with Desbordante: a Demo
item.description: However, most existing data profiling systems that focus on complex statistics do not provide proper integration with the tools used by contemporary data scientists.

item.title: Megalodon: Efficient LLM Pretraining and Inference with Unlimited Context Length
item.description: The quadratic complexity and weak length extrapolation of Transformers limits their ability to scale to long sequences, and while sub-quadratic solutions like linear attention and state space models exist, they empirically underperform Transformers in pretraining efficiency and downstream task accuracy.

item.title: Actions Speak Louder than Words: Trillion-Parameter Sequential Transducers for Generative Recommendations
item.description: Large-scale recommendation systems are characterized by their reliance on high cardinality, heterogeneous features and the need to handle tens of billions of user actions on a daily basis.

item.title: MyGO: Discrete Modality Information as Fine-Grained Tokens for Multi-modal Knowledge Graph Completion
item.description: To overcome their inherent incompleteness, multi-modal knowledge graph completion (MMKGC) aims to discover unobserved knowledge from given MMKGs, leveraging both structural information from the triples and multi-modal information of the entities.

item.title: Visual Autoregressive Modeling: Scalable Image Generation via Next-Scale Prediction
item.description: We present Visual AutoRegressive modeling (VAR), a new generation paradigm that redefines the autoregressive learning on images as coarse-to-fine "next-scale prediction" or "next-resolution prediction", diverging from the standard raster-scan "next-token prediction".

item.title: Arc2Face: A Foundation Model of Human Faces
item.description: This paper presents Arc2Face, an identity-conditioned face foundation model, which, given the ArcFace embedding of a person, can generate diverse photo-realistic images with an unparalleled degree of face similarity than existing models.

item.title: State Space Model for New-Generation Network Alternative to Transformers: A Survey
item.description: In this paper, we give the first comprehensive review of these works and also provide experimental comparisons and analysis to better demonstrate the features and advantages of SSM.

item.title: LLaVA-UHD: an LMM Perceiving Any Aspect Ratio and High-Resolution Images
item.description: To address the challenges, we present LLaVA-UHD, a large multimodal model that can efficiently perceive images in any aspect ratio and high resolution.

item.title: Unrecognizable Yet Identifiable: Image Distortion with Preserved Embeddings
item.description: In the realm of security applications, biometric authentication systems play a crucial role, yet one often encounters challenges concerning privacy and security while developing one.

item.title: RecAI: Leveraging Large Language Models for Next-Generation Recommender Systems
item.description: This paper introduces RecAI, a practical toolkit designed to augment or even revolutionize recommender systems with the advanced capabilities of Large Language Models (LLMs).

item.title: ControlNet++: Improving Conditional Controls with Efficient Consistency Feedback
item.description: To this end, we propose ControlNet++, a novel approach that improves controllable generation by explicitly optimizing pixel-level cycle consistency between generated images and conditional controls.

item.title: Joint Physical-Digital Facial Attack Detection Via Simulating Spoofing Clues
item.description: SPSC and SDSC augment live samples into simulated attack samples by simulating spoofing clues of physical and digital attacks, respectively, which significantly improve the capability of the model to detect "unseen" attack types.

item.title: TriForce: Lossless Acceleration of Long Sequence Generation with Hierarchical Speculative Decoding
item.description: However, key-value (KV) cache, which is stored to avoid re-computation, has emerged as a critical bottleneck by growing linearly in size with the sequence length.

item.title: Champ: Controllable and Consistent Human Image Animation with 3D Parametric Guidance
item.description: In this study, we introduce a methodology for human image animation by leveraging a 3D human parametric model within a latent diffusion framework to enhance shape alignment and motion guidance in curernt human generative techniques.

item.title: AutoCodeRover: Autonomous Program Improvement
item.description: Recent progress in Large Language Models (LLMs) has significantly impacted the development process, where developers can use LLM-based programming assistants to achieve automated coding.
